intro: Hieracium bonaquae, commonly known as the Bonaqua Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. Hieracium bonaquae is often found in areas with well-drained soil and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
